text:
Hello, I'm a HubSpot Newbie so I apologize in advance for my maybe stupid question.
I would like to add a third icon to a page. I copied the HTML structure and changed it accordingly. It still doesn't work because there is an ID that I have to change. However, I don't know what this ID should tell me, let alone where I can get a sequence of numbers from.

I copied "linked-wrap" and named it "insta-wrap". So far it worked. but when I insert the SVG with the code from the Instagram SVG, it no longer shows it to me.
I think the ID has no effect at this point. Does it work if you keep the class “linked-wrap”? I think that the CSS is the reason why the icon is displayed.
The ID should be unique and used only once on each page. Just rename it to something random.

Exactly, the icon is then displayed twice to me

I've already tried that, but it still doesn't appear
Maybe the attribute viewBox has a wrong value.

It works!

just a little too high :smile:

Hello again,
is there a possibility to disable some fields for Grid Elements like Section, Rows and Columns? E.g. container width and additional padding in sections are not very practiable or necessary for customers...
Please say that it is possible :sprocket-dance:
Hello everyone, I need your help, are html tables responsive?
Hi there, after downloading a template from the marketplace, how can I update things like a background color that appear to be hardcoded into the template?
if you give them a 100% width, sure
more advanced techniques have been written about <https://css-tricks.com/responsive-data-tables/>
